section.title: time and expense sheets management of Time and Expense Sheets
section.para: Time and Expense Sheets are documents used to capture time and expenses for Employees and Contractors. When Time and Expense Sheets are created, they appear on this workbench screen where managers can review and approve them all in one place.

note.para: For more information on using Time and Expense Sheets to help manage projects, please see the eBook Managing Projects with xTuple.

section.para: The following set up information will help ensure your Time and Expense Sheets are complete when you process them:

listitem.para: Should have compensation rate defined, but billing rate is optional. The compensation rate is used to determine the labor cost of Employees when their time entries are posted to the General Ledger (G/L). The billing rate may be used when Employees are doing billable work for a Customer, depending on the billing rate hierarchy defined for the Customer. To ensure Employees can be reimbursed for their expenses, Employees must also be defined as Vendors in the system.

Should also have compensation rate, but billing rate is optional. For Contractors, the compensation rate is used to determine the amount owed to Contractors for their time entries. Contractor costs are not posted directly as a Labor cost, as they are for Employees. Instead, Contractor time is vouchered and then Checks are written to the Contractorsâ€”thereby closing the Vouchers. Because Contractors are paid both for their time and their expenses, Contractors must be defined as Vendors in the system. Like Employees, the billing rate for Contractors may be used when Contractors are doing billable work for a Customer, depending on the billing rate hierarchy defined for the Customer.

section.para: To review Time and Expense Sheets, select the "Time and Expense Sheets" option. The following screen will appear:
When reviewing Time and Expense Sheets, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify which Employee Time and Expense Sheets you want to include in the display, using the specified date range:
Select to include Time and Expense Sheets for all Employees in the display.
Select to include a specific Employee's Time and Expense Sheets in the display.
Specify a date range for the Time and Expense Sheets you want to review:
Time and Expense Sheets dated on and after this date will be included in the display.
Time and Expense Sheets dated on and before this date will be included in the display.
Specify which Time and Expense Sheet statuses you want to include in the display:
Select to include open Time and Expense Sheets in the display.
Select to include approved Time and Expense Sheets in the display.
Select to include closed Time and Expense Sheets in the display.

Display will list Time and Expense Sheets based on the specified parameters. By right-clicking on a Time and Expense Sheet, you can perform several actions, including edit, print, delete, and approve.
Select one or more of the following options to be performed automatically when processing Time and Expense Sheets:
Select to generate an Invoice to bill the specified Customer for their billable time and/or expense entries on the selected Time and Expense Sheet(s). This option only applies to billable entries.

Select to generate a Voucher to reimburse Contractor type Employees for their expenses. In the case of Contractors, expense reimbursement may also be combined with payment for hours worked. Regular Employees are not paid in this way.
Select to post Employee labor and overhead costs to the General Ledger. This step applies to Employees only and does not apply to Contractors.

section.para: The following buttons are unique to this screen:

listitem.para: Select this button to create a new Time and Expense Sheet.
Highlight one or multiple open Time and Expense Sheets and then select this button to approve the highlighted Time and Expense Sheets.

Highlight one or multiple open Time and Expense Sheets and then select this button to process the highlighted Time and Expense Sheets, using the processing instructions indicated at the bottom of the screen.
